subskills.name: Gaining cultural knowledge

statements.stmt: When I’m going to visit a country, I look for information about it (e.g. climate, culture, geography…).
When I’m interacting or working with people from a different country, I search for information about this country.
I read foreign news and newspapers in my mother tongue.
I read foreign news and newspapers in a foreign language.
I read books written by authors from another culture.
I stay up to date on cultural trends in the countries I visit.
I stay up to date educational practices in the different countries I visit.

subskills.name: Understanding cultural perspectives

statements.stmt: I understand and respect people with different cultural backgrounds.
I understand that culture may influence behaviour and is an important factor to consider.
I know the main cultural factors influencing behaviour (e.g. religion, country, social class).
With respect to a particular culture, it is easy for me to identify what similarities there are with my own and which aspects are more different.

subskills.name: Enhancing own cultural identity

statements.stmt: I understand the key characteristics of my own culture and know how it differs from other cultures.
When I am in a group with people from different cultures, I can talk freely about my own values, my origins, my beliefs.

subskills.name: Enhancing cultural understanding

statements.stmt: I have learned a lot about cultural differences through following an international online course (e.g. a MOOC).
I have learned a lot about cultural differences through teaching an international online course (e.g. a MOOC).
I have done an internship in a company abroad.
I have stayed abroad in an immersive environment (e.g. au pair, in a family, for my job).
I have collaborated on a project with peers from abroad.

subskills.name: Demonstrating cultural understanding

statements.stmt: I learn and share information and knowledge with people from other cultural backgrounds.
I ensure that the content, methods, materials and overall learning experience are inclusive for all students and reflect the expectations and experiences of culturally diverse learners.

subskills.name: Applying intercultural awareness in culturally challenging circumstances

statements.stmt: I can speak easily with people from different cultures.
I am aware of and take into account the cultural stereotypes of the people I work with.
I have learned not to judge a colleague or a peer without first checking if there is a cultural reason for their behaviour.

2.name: Interactive and collaborative learning in an authentic international environment

subskills.name: Having enhanced team work skills

statements.stmt: In an international group, I cooperate in order to achieve a given objective.
I listen carefully to what other team members have to say.
I know how and when to use a wide range of processes and methods used in a team (brainstorming, surveys, meetings, etc.).
I facilitate the creation and production of new ideas in an international team.

subskills.name: Collaborating with peers from different disciplines

statements.stmt: I am interested in disciplines other than my own.
I can exchange knowledge with peers from disciplines other than my own.
I can collaborate with peers from disciplines other than my own.

subskills.name: Collaborating with peers within the context of an international learning experience

statements.stmt: I can engage in collaborative work with peers in an international teaching situation.

subskills.name: Interacting with authentic international resources in a foreign language

statements.stmt: In a foreign country, I am able to find and use information or content in a library and/or online, in the language of the country.
I can use authentic resources (e.g. TV or radio programmes, films, articles etc.) in a foreign language.

subskills.name: Demonstrating self-directedness in decision-making on own learning

statements.stmt: I encourage learners to set their own learning needs and to organise actions to meet them.
I use pedagogical approaches which support autonomous learning.

subskills.name: Engaging in digital networking

statements.stmt: I use social networks like Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn to participate in networks and to enhance my teaching.
I use social networks to collaborate in an international setting.

subskills.name: Dealing with complexity in networked learning

statements.stmt: I am able to enrich my own teaching by critically analysing the contributions of participants in networked learning situations.
I can tackle ill-defined and complex problems arising from collaboration in an international setting.

subskills.name: Demonstrating learner control

statements.stmt: I can control my teaching and learning environment.
I can control the time I spend online.
I have control over the personal data I use in online teaching.
I can control online interactions with learners.
I can control the sequencing of instructional material.
I can control the selection and design of learning content.
I can control the delivery medium.

subskills.name: Being proficient in using online learning technologies

statements.stmt: I am proficient in the use of online learning tools (e.g. LMS, e-portfolios).
I am proficient in online communication tools (messaging, web conferencing, forum etc.).

subskills.name: Being proficient in assessing quality in courses and resources found online

statements.stmt: I can evaluate online courses from the point of view of added value for learning.
I can assess the quality of the educational resources I find from the point of view of added value for learning.

subskills.name: Being able to self-regulate learning processes

statements.stmt: When I design a learning activity, I make provisions for learners to set their own goals and plan their own tasks.
When I design a learning activity, I make provisions for learners to monitor their own progress.
When I design a learning activity, I make provisions for learners to self-reflect on their achievement.

subskills.name: Being able to self-reflect on learning experiences

statements.stmt: I can reflect on feedback (positive or negative) from previous teaching experiences.

subskills.name: Demonstrating ownership over own learning (attitude)

statements.stmt: I can relate the course objectives to learners’ own needs and goals.

subskills.name: Being open-minded and tolerant

statements.stmt: I understand why other people’s worldviews, beliefs or cultures are important to them.
I am interested in getting to know people who are different to me.
I can imagine how people with different worldviews, beliefs or cultures from me will react to important issues.

subskills.name: Demonstrating self-confidence in interaction with peers and teaching staff

statements.stmt: I create an environment in which students feel they can express opinions and deal with possible disagreement.

subskills.name: Show willingness to improve proficiency in foreign languages

statements.stmt: I have learnt/am learning at least one foreign language.
I read and listen in one or more foreign languages.
I try whenever possible to have a dialogue in a foreign language.

8.name: Gaining Knowledge of Virtual Mobility and Open Education

subskills.name: Understanding Virtual Mobility

statements.stmt: I know what virtual mobility is.
I know of different virtual mobility programmes.
I am aware of how diverse modalities of virtual mobility can be useful for learning.

subskills.name: Understanding Open Education

statements.stmt: I know what the concept of Open Education entails.
I can identify the different opportunities offered by Open Education.
I understand the difference between Open Education and other forms of online learning.
I am aware of the potential of opening up education.
